column5: They are all in Lake Wahnapitae , This lake is only 25 minutes East of Sudbury, I have been fishing 21 years has never failed me I catch and release 90% of my fish 10 % goes to the dinner plate(nice to have freshly caught fish for supper)  Here are a few shots of my 2008 season (these were all released)
Wow!  I've fished lake Wanup through the ice...  but we only get chainies there..  Dems some purty fish there.  kewl! HD
lol love the fresh slime dripping off that big jack!
Hey what are you some kindof slime lover?

nice! My buddy went to a lodge up there a couple times...he doesn't take advice well though, so not listening to the lodge owner's advice had him missing out on the sort of stuff you've showed us.  Speaking of ice-fishing...is it a busy lake in the winter?
I thought only the beer store was busy in the winter.

hahaha saweeeeeet - I fished the crap out of that lake growing up.  My uncle had a cottage on the lake which eventually turned into his house and I spent nearly every weekend there as a kid.  Man I miss fishing that deep cold, rocky lake.  Some AWESOME smallie fishing in there if you know where and how to get'em.....  It's actually the only lake I ever ice-fished growing up as a kid.  We used to get eater lakers through the ice in 100+ FOW and by the time you got them to the surface they were bloated and dead as a door knob.  Got some big ling through the ice to.  fond memoirs man..... thanks for the pix
love the slime of a big jackfish.....reminds me of how fun they are.....and how much they stink all the same.......lol
A real good 2008 season for sure RT WTG guy  Leechman

Nice fish.  I lived in Garson from 1973 to 1981.  Graduated from GFSS in 1980. We used to go to the north river feeding into Wahnapitae in the spring for walleye.  I used to like to fish the kettle lakes near skead and the airport area for brookies.  I heard Ramsay is actually not a bad fishery now too even tho its right n the city.
damm RT wanna take me pickie fishing ill knock some cash off the VHF ya get me into some of them pigs lol,nice job
